name: Chef John's Cuban Sandwich
author: Chef John
summary: Here's how I build a Cuban, or Cubano, sandwich. I like to use pulled pork. Carnitas would work too. These ingredients and amounts are open to your own personal preferences, but here's the general idea.
ingredients: 1 ½ cups cooked pulled pork, heated
1 large dill pickle, sliced thinly lengthwise
directions: Mix mayonnaise, mustard, and cayenne together in a bowl to make the sauce
Cut loaf in half and evenly split bread to make tops and bottoms of 2 sandwiches
Spread each half on both sides generously with the mayo/mustard sauce
Divide sandwich ingredients between the two bottom halves in this order: 2 slices Swiss cheese, 3 slices ham, hot cooked pork, pickle slices, and 2 more slices of Swiss cheese
Melt butter in a heavy skillet over medium heat
Place sandwiches in skillet and press down with a heavy weight (such as another skillet or foil-wrapped bricks)
Toast sandwiches until bread is crisp and filling is heated through, 3 or 4 minutes per side
